latest_revision.comment: /* How can I tell which is which? */
latest_revision.text:
This documents Heatsync Labs policies around inventory management.

=Position statement=
Heatsync Labs is a Hackerspace, not a storage space.  As a result it should be actively used for work, not a place for things that might be worked on someday.  However, for large projects that are in-progress it is sometimes necessary for them to be temporarily left at the lab.  To facilitate that we have green Parking Passes to keep the number of projects manageable.  

= What does this apply to =
* Member projects
* Member materials
* Member tools

= What doesn't this apply to=
* Heatsync tools
* Heatsync materials
* Member tools on long-term loan to Heatsync

=How can I tell which is which?=
Lab equipment should have an [[asset tags]].

= Parking Passes =
Parking passes are green tags that are attached to your project.  They must have the following information:

* Your name
* Contact information
* Current date

[https://wiki.heatsynclabs.org/wiki/HYH_Meeting_2012-11-08 Parking passes are only valid for 7 days] and the project can not disrupt the function of the lab.

== Flat stock ==
Flat stock has slightly different rules due to the fact that it is bulky to transport and not everyone has a car to transport it back and forth.

* Flat stock may stay at the lab for 30 days, with a proper parking pass.
* After 30 days it is subjected to the same red tag process and can be either taken by a member or moved to scrap for community project use.

'''Note:'''  We may come up with a different process for this, but if so it will be updated via proposal and this page will hopefully be updated as well.

=Red tags=
Any equipment or material that has an expired or invalid (lacking date or member information) parking pass can be red-tagged at any time. Red tags are valid for 14 days.  Any time after 14 days the material can either be taken by a member or discarded.

== Process ==
* Fill out a red tag and attach it to the item in question
* Make a good faith effort to contact the member that owns the material.  This means you should:
** Call/text/email the contact information on the parking pass.
** Post to the Google group about the red tag.
** Post in slack (#red_tags) about the red tag.  @ the member directly as well to let them know.
